name: Interests Non-Standard Project Participation
text: Interests Non-Standard Project Participation

options.text: In home product tests – you will be sent a product to your home and asked to try it out and give us your opinions
Diary study – where we ask you to tell us about some of your daily activities over a few days or weeks
Community study – we ask you to take part in an interactive online forum over a few days or weeks, giving and discussing your views with others
Online tracking – where we ask you to let us monitor your internet behavior for a period of time and ask your opinions on what you have done
Run activities which take up to 30 mins of your time and start right now. They’re similar to surveys but involve you writing down your thoughts and opinions on some ideas / questions that brands have
No, I don’t want to take part in these kind of surveys

name: Primary Role (IT Roles)
text: Defines the primary role of respondent (as defined by MSFT), previously [Customer] MSFT - Primary Role (IT Roles)

options.text: You are an Information Technology (IT) executive, manager or staff person whose primary job position is in a formalised Information Technology (IT), information systems or MIS department of your company.
You perform the functions of an IT staff person, but work outside of a formalised IT department.
You create software applications, build or write computer code, develop websites or complex macros at work.
You have significant decision-making authority at work for your own department or multiple departments but you do NOT work in the IT department.
You create, use, transform, consume or manage information using a PC for work.
You use highly specialized computing platforms and applications to perform your work tasks.

You use word processing, spreadsheets, and presentations via a computer for work.  Your work is driven by projects, flexible tasks, and you make your own decisions on what to work on and how to accomplish each task.
You tend to perform the same tasks repetitively.  You have structured tasks, you receive, edit, author, and process information, and you make judgments using rules or standards.
You input data into computer systems.  Your day-to-day work is highly predictable.

name: Specific IT Role
text: More specifically, which of the following categories best describes you?

options.text: You have a management role, setting IT strategy and establishing alignment with business priorities, and you serve as the final IT decision maker.  (ITDM)
You have a management role, implementing IT strategy and responsible for tactical IT project management and delivery of solutions. ( ITM)
You have a staff role, supporting line-of-business applications including business intelligence, database administration, and / or business systems analysis. (LOB/App Specialist )
You have a staff role, supporting infrastructure planning, datacenter management, hosting, networking, security, cloud computing and/or server virtualization.(INF)
You have a staff role, dividing time between line-of-business applications, infrastructure support, and / or helpdesk and end-user support (but with none as a primary function).(GENERALIST)
You have a staff role, providing helpdesk and end-user support, including desktop administration, call center support, and / or training. (Help Desk)
